titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Daniel C. Wickliffe
CWG7704

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Military Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteers,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE
Louisville, Sep: 16 1862
Hon: D. C. Wickliffe
Sec of State --
Harrison Q Hughes Capt: having been examined by a Board of Surgeons & found unfit for duty, are hereby honorably discharged the service of the United States -- date of Com: Jan 24, 1862 --
-- Com: issd. & delivered to David A. Wolff 2d Lieut: ^date^ Sep: 16, 1862 --

Sep: 17. 1862
Commissions issued & delivered as follows:
D. L. Cunningham 2d Lieut: date Sep. 17, 1862,
J. Kemp Goodloe 3d Major " " " "
W. Howard Penigo 2d Lieut -- -- -- --

Resply
John W. Finnell
Adjt Genl Ken: Vols:
